text: Slavko Damjanović (, born 2 November 1992) is a Montenegrin football defender playing with Lokomotiv Tashkent in the Uzbekistan Super League. ==Club career== Born in Nikšić,Slavko Damjanovic at footballdatabase.eu Montenegro, back then within FR Yugoslavia, Slavko Damjanović played with Montenegrin clubs FK Čelik Nikšić, FK Mogren, FK Sutjeska Nikšić and FK Mornar, before moving to Serbia and playing with FK Spartak Subotica and FK Bačka 1901.Slavko Damjanović at zerozero.pt In summer 2015 he moved to Hungary and played with Békéscsaba 1912 Előre the entire season 2015–16 Nemzeti Bajnokság I.Slavko Damjanovic at nela.hu They finished the season 12th and ended relegated, thus Damjanović left Békéscsaba and returned to Montenegro where he signed with his former club FK Sutjeska Nikšić. He was announced to have signed for South African club Bidvest Wits F.C. early July 2017 as a free agent, playing in the South African Premier Division.Slavko Damjanovic profile at Soccerway ==Honours== ;Sutjeska *Montenegrin Cup: 2017 ;Bidvest Wits *Telkom Knockout: 2017 ;Budućnost *Montenegrin Cup: 2019 ==References== ==External links== * Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Nikšić Category:Association football central defenders Category:Montenegrin footballers Category:FK Čelik Nikšić players Category:FK Mogren players Category:FK Sutjeska Nikšić players Category:FK Mornar players Category:FK Budućnost Podgorica players Category:FK Spartak Subotica players Category:FK Bačka 1901 players Category:Békéscsaba 1912 Előre footballers Category:Bidvest Wits F.C. players Category:PFC Lokomotiv Tashkent players Category:Montenegrin Second League players Category:Montenegrin First League players Category:Serbian First League players Category:Nemzeti Bajnokság I players Category:South African Premier Division players Category:Uzbekistan Super League players Category:Montenegrin expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Serbia Category:Montenegrin expatriate sportspeople in Serbia Category:Expatriate footballers in Hungary Category:Montenegrin expatriate sportspeople in Hungary Category:Expatriate soccer players in South Africa Category:Expatriate footballers in Uzbekistan Category:Montenegrin expatriate sportspeople in Uzbekistan
title: Slavko Damjanović
